newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo rubber futures bounce back on stock news.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo rubber futures bounce back on stock news.

text.p: Tokyo rubber futures ended firmer on Monday, bouncing back from life-of-contract lows for most contracts following news that an increase in rubber stocks was smaller than initial forecasts, traders said.
Prices ranged from 0.5 yen to 1.9 yen per kg higher. Benchmark March was 0.5 yen firmer at 133.0 yen.

Japan rubber stocks increased to 47,873 tonnes at the end of September, up 209 tonnes from September 20. "The market had expected that stocks would have risen to 50,000 tonnes in end-September, and the smaller-than-expected increase fuelled moderate short-covering in the afternoon," one trader said.
